lines.line: Hello, are you ?
I am, but who are you?
I am Maria Gunnars, Mord's wife.
You should speak with my husband. He has been looking for you.
I am Maria Gunnars.
You should speak with my husband.
Hello,.
Hello, are you ? by any chance?
Well my name is, but I am known as by the Fremennik. May I ask who you are?
Of course, I am Mord Gunnars, a humble ferryman.
I come from an island north of here called Jatizso, while my wife Maria is from Neitiznot.
Hello.
The King of Jatizso has requested that I take you to him, as he has an important task for you.
Hello Mord.
Tell me more about Jatizso.
Well now, the history of the isles is a bloody tale. When told in its intended form it takes 9 days and 9 nights. However, I will give you the abridged version.
Phew!
Four generations ago there was a mighty king who ruled wisely and was loved by all.
He had many sons, most of whom proved themselves in the usual Fremennik ways of fighting, sailing, drinking and so on.
His youngest two sons, however, were a problem. Ever since they were old enough to hit one another they had bickered and fought.
Their names were Jatizso and Neitiznot.
Hey! Who's telling this story?
Ahem. At the time it was customary for the Kings' sons to claim a prize from his treasury when they came of age.
Each brother rallied support and strode out to confront the other on the field of battle to claim the same prize.
The brothers met on the field, limbs were bruised, bones were crushed and heads clashed.
They probably didn't notice the head-clashing bit. Too thick skulled!
Can I finish the story without interruptions?
Carry on dear.
Anyway, long into the night they fought, until they stood alone, facing each other.
On the second day the old king, whose patience was exhausted, strode out onto the field and demanded to know who had claimed his prize.
Jatizso looked at his father and told him yes, it was his, to which the other called out 'No! It's not'.
And so, the argument continued through to the third day, with the sounds of 'Jah! 'tis so!', 'Ne! It's not!' echoing over the field, becoming more hoarse as the darkness enveloped the brothers.
Bah! What they needed was a good clip round the ear.
At the end of the third day, when the brothers lay unable to move, let alone stand, the King stood between them in shame.
As punishment for their squabbling he banished his sons from his realm, ordering that neither should return until they had conquered lands of their own.
Jatizso set sail with a band of loyal followers, sailing into the east, while Neitiznot went west.
Jatizso ventured far into uncharted oceans, his crew dwindling as the trials of sailing and sea monsters took them.
Jatizso's ship limped through the frozen wastes, in need of repairs, fighting off pirates who thought them easy pickings.
At last a promising land was sighted, a land rich in minerals, deep fjords and sweeping mountains.
Jatizso claimed the land and named it after himself.
A mighty citadel was constructed to protect his land; then Jatizso set forth to explore his new kingdom.
Crossing a few fjords, Jatizso spied an island which remained green and fertile, even at such latitude.
With a mighty cheer Jatizso and his men marched on the island. Upon reaching the island, however, they discovered a wooden stockade.
Determined to be master of all the land, Jatizso stood in front of the gates. He looked up and demanded that those within the stockade surrendered.
Jatizso was horrified when his brother appeared on the battlements and cried 'This is my land! Go find yer own'. To which his brother replied 'No it's not!', throwing some rocks for good measure.
And so the blood feud continued.
The fighting between the towns has continued for generations with little sign of improvement.
Quite recently a massive troll army seized one of the islands to the north, while our townships' militias were busy fighting one another.
They marched down and razed Neitiznot to the ground while Neitiznot's troops laid siege to Jatizso.
The smoke damage was atrocious, I had to replace my entire wardrobe.
Yes, dear.
Anyway, a hasty sort of peace has been agreed until the trolls are dealt with.
But you can still see the bitter rivalry as guards hurl insults between the towns.
Tell me more about the King of Jatizso.
Ha! Our benevolent King Gjuki Sorvott IV.
He is short-tempered, arrogant and cares little about anything except outdoing Neitiznot's Burgher.
He's not at all like Burgher Burowgar.
I'm surprised King Sorvott wishes to talk to you. Don't expect much in the way of gratitude.
Can you ferry me to Jatizso?
Of course.
I'm too busy to help your King.
I guess I won't be getting paid for finding you, then.
I may be back later.
Hi, you should speak with King Sorvott in the main chambers.
The chambers have the town's banner erected outside.
Thank you for bringing me here Mord.
Is there anything I can do for you?
Jatizso is a small Fremennik town, which is far less closed to the world than other Fremennik tribes.
We maintain trade links with many powers in the world and have moved beyond some traditions to take advantage of modern advances.
We do, however, continue to 'enlighten' our neighbours in Neitiznot. Unfortunately, some of the Islands are infested with trolls.
We should really be trying to deal with the trolls, but the King tends to get a bit preoccupied with his cousin, the Burgher of Neitiznot.

Ha! Our benevolent King Gjuki Sorvott IV. He doesn't have much of an opinion about anyone, apart from his cousin Mawnis who rules the other Island. He hates him with a passion that can occasionally be quite scary.
You might be able to talk to him if you help out around Jatizso. Don't expect much in the way of gratitude though.
Can you ferry me to Rellekka?
Sure.
No, I'm fine right now.

Oh, hello stranger. If you're new to town you should speak with our ruler, King Gjuki Sorvott IV. He'll want to meet you - he always wants to have a chat with any strangers in town. They could be spies you know.
Spies?
Yes, spies from Neitiznot. They're everywhere. Apparently. That's what the King says anyway.
So what do you do here?
Me? I'm a cook. Fish dishes a speciality. I hate fish. But fish is about all we have. Except for yak. But we're not allowed to eat yak.
Why not, is yak meat bad for you?
Certainly not! Yak meat is both sweet and delicately flavoured. Yak is juicier than buffalo and elk - but never gamey. It goes wonderfully well with a glass of red wine, and it's healthy too!
So why aren't you allowed to eat it?

King's orders. They breed and eat yaks on Neitiznot, so WE'RE not allowed to. It's unjust I tell you! I had a dream last night about a juicy fillet of yak, served on a bed of deep-fried seaweed and topped with a garnish
of crumbly yak's cheese.
That's a little sad. So do you have any cooked food I could buy?
No. It would only be fish anyway. Why would you want to eat fish?
Well, I wouldn't mind a few shark and swordfish steaks as back-up you know.
If you insist. Sorry the stock is so low, but I just can't be bothered to cook any more.
Hello. What's happening in town at the moment?
These dwarves have arrived from Keldagrim - the Chancellor has asked me to look after them, but they are eating all of our food and drinking all of our booze.
What are the dwarves doing here?
They are organising some sort of trade agreement. I don't know what they are trading.
Thanks.
Hmm, interesting place this. It feels a little like Kelda, except without the good bits.
Bored, bored, bored. These Fremenniks are taking ages.
Hey, they're doing their best. You arrived early.
Hey, we arrived precisely when we told your representatives. Lack of planning on your part does not constitute an emergency on my part.
Please, someone get these guys their ore quickly. They are eating all the good food on the island, and complaining about it!
I'd better get a move on!
Welcome,.
Please introduce yourself to our ruler, His Royal Greatness King Gjuki Sorvott IV.
Guard, who is this outlander?
Meeow?
This is, your majesty.
Is this true? You are the outlander who has been given a Fremennik name?
Miouw...meow.
Indeed I am.
Excellent.
How may I assist your Highness?
Meouw!
Behave Hrafn!
Meeeiouw! Mewwww!
I have a task that requires your unique-
MEEEEOOOUW!!!!
Not now, Hrafn.
Now where was I?
You mentioned a task requiring my unique-
Ah, yes.
Your unique position among Fremennik-
MEEEIOOOOUW! MIOOOOOEW! YOOWLLL!
Hrafn! Oh, alright, alright, I give in.
Purrr.
Look, could you fetch my cat some fish?
Then we can finish our conversation in peace.
Yes, that's probably a good idea.
Thank you.
Hrafn will only eat raw tuna.
Will any raw tuna do?
Yes, fussy though Hrafn is, he doesn't care where the tuna comes from.
If you don't already have any, you can catch some down by the docks, or you can buy some from my fishmonger, Flosi Dalksson.
Halt, in the name of King Gjuki Sorvott IV.
Oh, its you again.
Hello,. That cat really is a pain isn't he? Always interrupting the King.
Oh, I've met worse. Still, I'd better get him his fish, otherwise he'll never keep quiet.
Oh, go and talk to Flosi Dalksson in his shop. He'll have some tuna if you don't have any. You could also fish it from one of the spots round here, if you prefer.
Thanks!
Here you go, enjoy your fish.
What is the meaning of this serf? One specifically asked for RAW tuna, not fish defiled by human fire!
Here you go. Enjoy your fish.
What is the meaning of this serf? How is one supposed to eat a piece of paper?
Here you go. enjoy your fish!
Purrrrrrrrrr (One is satisfied with the freshness of the tuna. The humans have acted satisfactorily in this matter.)
Hello again,.
Do you have a piece of raw tuna for Hrafn?
Not yet, your Highness.
Miouw!
Well, what are you waiting for?
Yes, I have your pet's fish.
Meow.
Now, what was I saying?

Ah, yes, so the Burgher of Neitiznot Island is an enemy of free-thinking Jatizso citizens. My informants tell me an increased number of trade ships have been seen docking at their ports. They must be preparing for something. Chancellor, fill in the details.
Sire, Sire! The Kelda merchants have arrived, they are three days early. We're not ready!
What? We cannot afford to offend the Red Axe traders. Where are they now?
They are in the hall, eating and drinking us out of food and beer. It's costing us a fortune.
Another good reason to get them their ore and get them out of town. Get all our miners on the job now!
I already have. They'll never get enough ore in time, the bunch of lazy no-good layabouts.
Bah! Those miners haven't learned their lesson.
It may be time for some extra incentives.
Wait a minute! I'm fairly handy with a pick axe. Maybe I can help; what do you need?
We need pieces of for Keldagrim's merchants.
The entrance to our mines are to the north-east of the western gatehouse, outside the walls.
If I just happen to have the ore you need in the bank, do I need to go down to your mines?
If you bring us the ore, we won't ask where it came from. Don't worry we're discreet.
Hmmm, interesting. I'll get the ore then.
Can you tell me where to find the nearest mines?
Err, there are some mines just outside the western gatehouse. I don't know what the rocks contain there though, you'll have to have a look.
Is there anything I can help you with?
Can I have a look at your stock please?
No, nothing just now thanks.
Do you have the ore?
Can you remind me of what those Dwarven traders need?
Of course. Please bring pieces of ore.
And the mines are...
The entrance to the mines is outside the western gatehouse, on the north side of the town.
I have bank notes to the value of the ore here.
I have the ore here.
Excellent. This has gathered the pieces of ore needed by Keldagrim's merchants, sire.
Good, good. Please reward this for efforts.
Do you have all the ore my Chancellor requested?
Not yet.
Please hurry back with, Keldagrim's traders are drinking my cellars dry.
I have the ore here, sir.
This has gathered the remaining ore needed by Keldagrim's merchants.
Excellent news, your majesty.
Please reward this for efforts.
Of course, your majesty.
Thank you. If only our miners were as efficient as you.
Right. Now let us get down to business, young. Let us hope we have no more interruptions.
Certainly, your Majesty.
Neitiznot's Burgher, Mawnis Burowgar, is a simpleton and a fool.
I have bested him before and will do so again!
He is surely plotting a new plan to defeat me.
He's up to something, he's always up to something.
I will not be kept in the dark about his plans any longer. I must know what underhand tricks he'll use to undermine me. He's out to get me! Get me I say!
Ahem, I see, sir. How may I help in this matter?
Well, I have heard that some call you 'bard' in Rellekka. Your lyre-playing reputation has carried this far.
You want me to play the lyre? Well actually, I've been working on a few tunes in my spare time. I have this new song about-
Silence! I do not wish to hear your wailing. All bards are charlatans and fools.
However, a fool is exactly what I need right now.
Oh.
It's a great tune, very catching, you'll love-
Bah! Bards are all the same, they never shut up! If I need to be entertained I'll hire a mime; maybe I'll get some rest then. Now if you'll listen, I'll explain what I need you to do.
In the past I have sent my Spymaster to 'entertain' the Burgher, and to see what he can find out.
You see, the Burgher of Neitiznot and his aides like a drink when they are being entertained, and their tongues are loose when they drink.
However, yesterday my spy had an accident and could no longer help me in this task. However he is still stationed on Neitiznot.
So this is a covert operation into Neitiznot? You need me to infiltrate the Burgher's hall, undercover, and uncover his evil plans?
Exactly,. So are you interested?
Sounds like a task for an elite adventurer like myself. Mission accepted.
Excellent, you and I will get on very well.
So what is the easiest way to get to Neitiznot?
I suggest you catch Mord's ferry back to Rellekka and then catch a ferry from there.
Are you sure that's the best way?
You may find a way across the islands, but the bridges are almost certainly broken, and there are trolls which are a bit of a nuisance. The ferry is probably both quicker and safer.
I'll be off then
Oh, there is one more thing. In order to gain an audience with the Burgher, you will need my Spymaster's, err, costume.
Costume?
The costume is in my chest. Don't forget to pick up all the pieces.
Then travel to Neitiznot and talk to my Spymaster. He is still over there. He will fill you in with the details, and you may report to him.
Oh, the Spymaster is a secretive kind of guy. He will require a password. The password is 'free stuff please'.
What sort of password is that?
Don't ask me, it was his idea.
Fine. What's his name?
His name is Slug Hemligssen, but don't expect him to answer to it.
So how will I recognise him?
Don't worry, you'll find him.
Why are you still here?
Well it seemed rude not to finish the food they gave us.
Feel free to leave it. Please leave.
I'll just finish the roast off.
Ah, yes. Now that's what I call a meal.
That's funny, I called it fourteen meals yesterday.
Have you finished the covert operation I asked you to complete?
No, not yet.
Well, what are you waiting for? Hop to it!
Yes sir!
Have you completed your undercover mission to Neitiznot yet?
Then make sure you have your costume and go. There is no time to play around!
You will look lovely in that outfit.
You look lovely in that outfit.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
What do you think you're wearing, ?
It's a Spymaster costume. Apparently.
Is that so? I've half a mind not to let you on the boat wearing that outfit. All those bells will scare the fish and maybe even attract pirates.
This outfit wasn't my idea.
Designed to subtly blend into the background, no doubt?
Clearly.
Hello, ?
Hello.
I am Maria Gunnars. What can I do for you?
Tell me about Neitiznot's geography.
Sure.

Well, as I have mentioned, I am from an island called Jatizso, while my wife is from another island called Neitiznot. Neitiznot is a far less sophisticated and successful island which will not see reason with Jatizso.
Ne it iz not!
Ja it iz so!
Ahem, anyway, the islands are in a small volcanic archipelago north of here.
Along with the main isles there are numerous small islands and a frozen northern island that was recently overrun by trolls.
Jatizso is rich in minerals, and trades extensively, while Neitiznot has stolen all the decent arable land.
Only because Jatizso hogs all the wealth.
Well, that wealth is needed to buy the food from Neitiznot at extortionate rates!
Only because Jatizso hogs all the wealth!
Ok Maria, stop that!
Ok dear!
Thank you!
Where was I? Yup, that covers the layout of the islands.
Tell me about Burger Mawnis Burowgar.
Well Burgher Mawnis Burowgar is a gentle soul at heart. His kinsfolk are happy and content with their lot.
'Soft' is the word we use in Jatizso.
Well a soft Burgher is better than a stupid King.
Anyway, there was a time when Burgher Burowgar was similar to King Sorvott.
Argumentative, short tempered; I am sure you know what I mean.
The change happened when the trolls came and razed Neitiznot to the ground.
You mean while Neitiznot's militias were assaulting Jatizso.
Yes, well our tribes have been at war for nearly four generations now.
Anyway, the Burgher lost his wife and youngest son in the trolls' raid and has been a changed man since.
May their journey to our ancestors' halls be swift.
Personally, I am much happier with the considerate Burgher we have now.
Can you ferry me to Neitiznot?
Let's set sail then.
I just stopped to say hello.
Thanks, and good luck with the Burgher's tasks.
Hi, you should speak with Burgher Mawnis Burowgar in the main chambers. Do you have any questions?
Tell me about your husband.
My husband is a typical Fremennik, being both headstrong and brave.
We fell in love when we were young, but as there was a war between our isles, we were ordered to stop seeing each other by our parents.
This didn't stop Mord climbing the wailing tower, on his side of the channel between our isles, to sing to me every night.
After Mord's voice broke, his singing voice was lost, but I still listened to his terrible sonnets each and every night.
Until one night there was no singing! Then, far below me, I heard a gentle voice calling my name.
Mord had stolen his father's boat to come and fetch me from my prison
and from that day forth we have lived in Rellekka.
Tell me about Jatizso.
My husband does not speak of the inhabitants of the isle of Jatizso much.
He has little positive to say about his parents, so he chooses not to speak of them in my presence. The only thing I've noticed is that everyone on that island seems very sad...
Tell me about King Sorvott IV.

King Sorvott IV follows in the footsteps of a line of kings who have reigned since Jatizso himself passed away. It is rumoured that the King has no heir and is seeking a bride to bear him children. Given his
personality I'm not surprised he hasn't found a bride yet!
Tell me about Neitiznot.
To be honest with you, I do not keep up to date with all the goings on here now that I have a home in Rellekka.
However, Neitiznot seems a happy place! The Burgher seems a wiser rule than King Sorvott, although I believe he is worried about the trolls at the moment. They seem to be a big threat.
I have nothing to ask you right now.
Fare thee well.
Good day!
Can't talk now, I'm on duty.
Hello, outlander. Don't disturb the Burgher, he has many important duties to take care of.
Oh, I'll come back later.
Guards! Please escort this outlander to the docks. She is not welcome in my court.
I am known as by those in Rellekka.
Do you have me confused with the King of Jatizso? Guards!
I shall return to Rellekka. You have no need to call your guards.
Oh, jester! Do not disturb the Burgher, he is busy with matters of import.
What are you doing in Neitiznot, outlander?
I am no outlander, but maybe you can help me.
I am looking for King Sorvott IV?
Then you should get back on a ship and sail to Jatizso then, fool. You will need to ask Maria to ferry you back to Rellekka first.
Thanks, Thakkrad.
Please jester, we don't have time for entertainment right now.
Guards, what is this outlander doing in the Burgher's chambers?
Halt outlander!
Well you are on the wrong island. You should return to Rellekka and ask Mord to take you to Jatizso.
Thanks. I'll be on my way.
Hello.
Not very talkative are you?
Nope.
I'll be off then.
Yup.
The blue fish leap northwards at dawn..
Oranges are not the only fruit.
The cabbages bloom in the spring.
My cows produce milk in the evening.
I bought an aardvark from Ardougne market.
Yellow balloons are heavier in boxes.
...err...sprockets wangle burps in the forked flan.
You have no idea what you are talking about do you?
No, not really.
It rains frogs during the Winter in Neitiznot.
Free stuff please.
Ah, Operative Budgie. Welcome to the island.
Budgie? That's not my name, you can call me-
Shh!
No names! Names are unnecessary. Loose lives cost tongues.
Shouldn't that be...never mind. So Mr Hemli-
Shhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!
Sorry, no names. I forgot.
Call me Operative Nighthawk.
How come you get the cool name, and I get called Budgie? Can't I be called Operative Panther? Yeah I like that, panthers are cool. Rarrrr!
This is not a democracy, Operative! Panther already exists and he's working on a mission in Al Kharid. It's my way or the highway.
Fine, whatever, I don't care anyway.
To business. Here are the details of your operation. You will infiltrate Burgher Burowgar's hall, deep undercover as a travelling entertainer. Burgher Burowgar and his men are known to relax in the
presence of a jester - and a few barrels of beer. To get the information required from the court of Burgher Burowgar you must entertain him.
While you are obeying the Burgher's instructions you should listen in on the conversations of his council and make note of what they discuss.
When you return I shall ask you a few questions about what you have learned.
Very well.
You must wear all four pieces of the jester costume without anything in your hands, as the Burgher's guards will search you thoroughly.
Are you ready to begin?
I am ready.
Not dressed like that you're not! You'd better get the rest of your kit, or empty your hands if you have anything in them.
I just need to visit the bank.
Hurry back; we must know what Neitiznot's ruler is planning.
I shall return soon.
Colourless green ideas sleep furiously.
Have you infiltrated the Burgher's leisure quarters?
Not yet. I'll do that now.
Err, hello. I'm an unemployed jester looking for work.
Ah! A fool. Excellent. The Burgher enjoys a watching a fool. Are you a fool? Ha Ha!
That was very clever what you did there - using the double meaning for humour. I've never heard that before. Genius.
So, are you a fool? HA HA HA!
Yes, I am a fool. Are you happy now?
HA HA HA!
*sigh* Simple things entertain simple minds.
Pardon?
Nothing. Are you going to let me perform for the Burgher?
Mmm? Oh yes of course. You'd better introduce yourself.
Errr, hello. I'm an unemployed jester looking for work.
Ah! A fool. Excellent. The last entertainer I had was not up to standard.
Well, I'm as entertaining as a juggler with a bag of ferrets down his trousers.
HA HA HA! Now that's funny.
I like an easy, I mean appreciative, audience.
Shall I start?
Mm? Oh yes of course...bag of ferrets eh? Haha!
Well, new Jester! This had better be good.
I hope I can amuse and delight as much as your last jester.
If you can amuse or delight me at all, you'll be doing much better than the last one.
Actually his juggling was quite funny. Shame about the accident though.
Bah, if he'd been a decent juggler, he could have juggled the battleaxe, flaming torches, and greased pigs we threw at him.
I see, a tough crowd then. I'd better get this right!
Aha! An encore?
Every good performance deserves a reprise.
Well, thank you, that was much better than the last jester.
The fool is back.
Ha, more fool you! Ha Ha Ha!
Your wit has no end. Or beginning or middle. I'd better talk to the Burgher and see if he wants to be entertained.
Have you obtained the information we require?
Yes I have.
Now I will ask you some questions, but be warned I have other sources of information that will corroborate your answers.
I am ready to answer your questions, Operative Nighthawk.
How soon does Thakkrad think Neitiznot's troops can be ready?
They will be ready in two days.
How many militia have been trained?
Seventeen militia have been trained.
How many bridges does Thakkrad need repairing?
There are two bridges to repair.
Hmmm. I believe you're telling me the truth.
I would not lie to you.
Well done! I shall inform the King of your good work. I have been authorised to give you this...
Thanks to you, we know a little more about Neitiznot's plans.
While you were deep undercover, I received instructions from 'Big Daddy'.
'Big Daddy'? Do you mean the K-
Shhhh! Yes, I mean the head operative back at home-base. He has given me permission to follow up any leads based on your intelligence.
It would be useful to know exactly when the Neitiznot engineers intend to repair the bridges. I'd do it myself but my injury stops me.
Curse this arm and my reckless bravery in the pursuit of intelligence!
I heard you had an accident whilst juggling?
*ahem* Misinformation my. Misinformation and misdirection.
Is that so?
Anyway, enough chit-chat.
You should gain the trust of the Burgher.
You must not mention our arrangement.
Indeed, if you are offered tasks by Neitiznot's folk or Burgher, you should go along with them to avoid arousing suspicion.
Once you know that the bridges have been repaired then return to me.
Do not think you can lie to me. Come back when you are more inclined to give me the information I require.
I need to make a fool of myself again.
You'd better go back to the Burgher and get entertaining.
I shall, Mr Nighthawk.
What am I supposed to be doing again?
Operative 'Big Daddy' requests that you gain the trust of Mawnis Burowgar, and determine whether they intend to repair the bridges that link their island to home-base. Mission understood?
Yes, I think so.
Get a move on then.
Oh, and stay away from me unless you need to contact me. It will begin to look suspicious.
Right. Yes. You blend right in otherwise.
The Burgher does not require entertainment at the moment, jester.
Ho, outlander! Please introduce yourself to the Burgher.
Ah! Are you the outlander called ?
Yes I am. What can I do for you?
The Burgher would like to talk to you urgently. Please talk to him right away.
Welcome back, how was your time on Jatizso?
Very rewarding, thank you Maria.
I have been asked to ferry you to Neitiznot, as Burgher Mawnis Burowgar would like to make you an offer.
Do you have any questions?
Welcome to Neitiznot, ; Mawnis Burowgar lives in the largest hut in the township.
He is expecting you, so you should not keep him waiting for too long.
Thank you for ferrying me here Maria. See you soon.
If you have any questions I would be happy to answer them.
Good luck in Neitiznot.
Go away! I'm busy right now with important matters of state.
Ah, jester. I am not currently in need of jest.
Right now I need a Champion, not a jester.
Ah yes.
The Burgher is both wise and perceptive.
Ha! Fortunately for you he also has a sense of humour.
Hmmmm. Guard! Who is this outlander who has been brought before me?
Sire, this is the one who has been honoured with a Fremennik name. A rare honour indeed, for an outlander.
You jest! doesn't look that impressive to me.
Ahem. I am indeed known as by those in Rellekka.
If I am the one you seek, then how may I assist you?
Well, I have sought an audience with you for several days now.
I have need for a courageous and valiant individual.
One who will not flee at the sight of jest a few trolls.
Ha! It is trolls that fear me! I am Fremennik!
Ha! Well said! However, this is no jesting matter. Although a Fremennik name goes a great way towards gaining my trust, I must ask that you prove your loyalty to me and my kinsfolk.
Sire, surely that isn't necessary! Anyone who has done the Fremennik Trials can be trusted.

Trust me Fridleif, I think in this case it is necessary. Anyway, there are many tasks that need to be done. Some of them are menial, and needs to show me that can handle these as well as the ones that
simply require bravery. We on Neitiznot are warriors, but we are not just warriors.
I apologise for speaking out of turn. The Burgher is wise as always.
I would be honoured to assist you and your tribe, Burgher Burowgar. Indeed I expected no less. This sort of thing seems to happen to me a lot.
Good.
Thakkrad, which tasks remain?
There are a few building projects that could do with a strong extra hand.
Well then, are you willing to assist my engineer?
Of course, Mawnis Burowgar.
The bridges to the troll islands need repairing if we are to send a party over. First of all, we will need eight lengths of rope; maybe could assist me with this.
It's quite simple really. Gather some yak hair and take it to the spinning wheel in the south-east of the village.
There you will be able to spin the yak hair you have gathered into strong lengths of rope.
Is any rope fine for this?
Of course not. Neitiznot rope is the best. Real men use yak rope. You need to make the rope yourself.
Hmmm, the rope I've seen round here looks exactly the same as the rope I'm used to. It's exactly the same isn't it?
Well yes, of course it is. We supply rope to all of the rope traders in Gielinor. Its an excellent business.
Anyway, once you have obtained the rope we shall speak more about the quest I have for you. So get a move on!
Right! I'll just go to the bank and get some rope.

Bank? Why do you need to go to a bank? Neitiznot is the home of quality rope. The hairs of the local yak have the perfect combination of strength and hardiness required from modern rope. Yak rope is stronger and
better than any other rope.
I thought rope was made from wool. Not yak hair.
Wool? Wool? What a load of old rope. Wool would make awful rope - its far too soft and it would soak up the water too easily.
So how come Ned from Draynor makes rope out of wool?
Ned? I don't know anything about Ned. I do know we make regular trades with someone in that area. We send them rope, and we get wool in return.
So Ned doesn't make the rope? What a fraud! He had me fooled for so long.
Anyway, so that means that all rope is made by Neitiznot from yak hair.
Indeed.
So if I happen to have some rope in the bank then that would also be made from high quality Neitiznot yak hair.
Well, yes.
So I could just give you the rope I already have, rather than make more rope?
I suppose so. You should really try to make some rope yourself though. Fighting the dual challenges of the yak's hooves and its smell is part of becoming a man over here.
I've had enough of strange 'coming of age' rituals for the time being. I'm going to go to the bank and get the rope you need.
Suit yourself.
As it happens, I'm carrying a note for enough rope on me right now.
A note? How do you fix a bridge with a note? Go bring me some real rope.
As it happens, I'm carrying enough rope on me right now.
That's a coincidence.
It is.
Do you normally carry all that rope around with you?
Err, no. I had a feeling I'd need it.
Are you some kind of seer?
Not exactly.
Hey! You're not some sort of witch are you? Maybe I have trusted you too much.
No, no, no! Its just a coincidence. Err, I spend my time trading rope. Yes that's right. I'm a rope trader and I just happen to have my wares on me.
You have come to the home of all rope to sell us...rope. What a load of old rope (ahem).
You asked for it! Do you want this rope or not?
Alright then. Let's have a look at his rope then.
You don't have space for the Burgher's reward.
Hello, ! If you need help with your tasks then you are welcome to talk to the Burgher or his advisors.
Hello again. Do you have the eight pieces of rope that Thakkrad asked you for?th
No, I still don't have them.
You can collect pieces of hair from the yaks that roam our isle, then spin it into rope.
Thank you, I shall return soon.
There is a spinning wheel in the south-east of the village.
Have you collected all the rope we need yet?
Hello, Operative Nigh-
Shhh, and stay away from me unless you need to contact me. It will begin to look suspicious.
Hello again. Do you have the eight pieces of rope that Thakkrad asked you for?
I have them right here!
Ah, excellent quality rope. Good work,.
Thakkrad! Please reward for efforts.
Good work, we will need that rope later. Put it somewhere safe for the time being would you?
I'll do that shortly.
So, I've done your menial task; what is this secret quest? That's what really interests me.
My, you are both impertinent and impatient. I have two more tasks for you before I am willing to tell you the full details.
Very well, what must I do next?
Thakkrad?
I require eight arctic pine logs, which have been split in two. Arctic pines grow around the village and there is a 'Woodcutting stump' in the centre of the village you can split the logs on.
I see. That shouldn't be a problem.
Once you have eight pieces of rope and eight split logs I will explain how you can use them to repair the bridges that the trolls attacked a few days ago.
I would be happy to help your kinsfolk, Mawnis Burowgar.
Ah, a bit more respect. That's better.
I shall speak with you again once you have prepared these split logs.
Hello again; do you have the eight split logs that Thakkrad asked you to make?
Hello again, do you have the eight split logs that I asked you to make?
You must fell eight arctic pine then split the logs in two with an axe.
Thank you sir, I shall return soon.
I have them right here.
My, that was fast.
has returned with the split logs you asked for. Please reward for efforts.
Good work. Now that you have both the rope and split logs I shall explain how you go about repairing our bridges.
Once this is complete I shall explain the quest I have for you.
Thakkrad, could you explain what needs doing next?
I would like you to repair the two bridges leading to the northern isle.
To repair each bridge you will need four pieces of rope, four split logs and a knife.
Very well, I shall get on with that now.
You may find a bridge to a small isle, rich in resources. You will not be able to repair it, as I still have to replace the main supports. Leave that bridge - we don't need it to make our raid.
I shall speak with you again once you have repaired the bridges.
You should speak to Burgher Mawnis Burowgar about repairing our bridges.
Do you need any help with the bridge repairs?
How do I repair these bridges again?
You will the need the split arctic pine logs and the coils of rope you collected earlier. You will need one for of each per bridge. You will also require a knife.
Where do I find these bridges?

If you leave the west gate you will find a couple of bridges that lead to a thin strip of island north of this one. Both bridges that need to be repaired lead northwards from this island; one to the west and
another near the centre. There is another bridge to the East, but you don't need to worry about that one.
No, thanks.
Ho there! have you repaired both bridges for my engineer?
Do you need any help?
Thakkrad? Can you fill in the details?
I have carried out your orders, Sir.
Excellent. We are one step closer to putting my plan into action.
Now that the bridges are repaired I feel I can tell you of our plans.
First, I shall have my engineer reward you for you efforts.
has repaired both bridges. Please reward for efforts, Thakkrad.
That is most generous of you, Sir.
We are a generous folk, over here on Neitiznot.
Good work! Now that you have repaired our bridges I can make the final preparations for our assault on the troll caves.
Troll caves!
Long ago, the ancestors of this isle fought heroically against the troll menace upon these isles.
But, for the last few generations, we have been preoccupied with fighting our neighbours on Jatizso.

In our complacency, the trolls have grown in number and strength and have become increasingly brazen in their raids, attacking our kinsfolk, stealing and destroying our belongings. Now the time has come for
us to drive the trolls from this isle. We must defeat their leader, the foul Troll King.
Although I am confident we will be victorious, I am a cautious man.
We have suffered for many generations and the blood of our ancestors grows weak.
But now, in this time of prosperity, Fridleif has recruited the bravest Fremennik warriors from far and wide to win back our honour.
Now that you have proven your loyalty, I offer you the honour of leading my forces into battle.
What say you, ?
I am honoured, Burowgar.
I gratefully accept your offer to lead the charge against your foes.
Excellent! Once Fridleif's militia arrive and are fully equipped we shall head north into the troll caves.
Glory to the Fremenniks.
Death to the trolls.
I have one last concern. I suspect that King Sorvott may have some idea that we intend to make this raid.
I'm afraid that may be true sire.

If he and his men were willing to aid us in this task then that would not be a problem, however I suspect that Sorvott will see our actions and misinterpret them. He may well attempt to prevent us. I need to know the

extent of his knowledge so that I may plan., I suspect that you may be able to help us here. I find underhand methods distasteful, however I ask you to go to Jatizso and find the King's plans by whatever means
you are familiar with.
I can do this sire.
Do you need anything from me to help you?
Err, no. I believe I already have all the...contacts I need.
Excellent. Then make your way with haste.
My militia are still gathering in Rellekka. Have you found out anything about Jatizso's plans yet?
Not yet sir, but I shall return soon.
Have you found out about Jatizso's plans yet, ?
Thanks Thakkrad, i'm on my way there now.
Our militia are still preparing themselves for our raid against the trolls.
Have you found out about Jatizso's plans yet?
Not yet, but I am on my way there now.
Hello again, I hear you are to be appointed as the Burgher's Champion?
He said something about leading his forces into battle, but I didn't hear the Burgher use the word 'champion'.
Well you see, Mawnis Burowgar is a superstitious man. He lost a Champion, several years back. It was really embarrassing...
The Champion strapped so much armour to himself that he fell straight through the jetty on arrival here and didn't even meet the Burgher.
So you see, Mawnis won't use the term 'Champion' often, as he believes it brings bad luck.
Welcome back. How was your time on Neitiznot?
You should speak with my husband. King Sorvott has been asking for you.
I hope your mission was successful. Talk with the King, I'm sure he has some things he wishes to discuss with you.
Have you gathered the information about when Neitiznot's bridges will be repaired?
I have, sir. They have been repaired.
Outrageous, how are they working so rapidly?
The Fremennik are a very resourceful folk, your majesty.
That may be, but we are very different from the vermin on Neitiznot.
We must amass our troops immediately. We must be ready for Neitiznot's army to attack us.
Your majesty.
Chancellor, how are the city's coffers? We will need to pay for weapons and food for our soldiers.
Would you like the financial report now, sir?

Once we have paid for all the supplies you...err...I have ordered, your Royal Highness, then the coffers will be at their lowest ebb for some time. However, if we tighten our belts and delay your plans for extra
defences, then-
What! That is not acceptable! How am I supposed to run this city when I am surrounded by incompetence!

Now, more than ever, we need to protect ourselves from the threat from Neitiznot. This is a time of national crisis. Every citizen of Jatizso must bear the burden of protecting our homes. If it means that as
citizens we must sacrifice some luxuries for the good of Jatizso, then it must be so. We must raise more taxes.
But we have already collected Island Taxes this month! We'll never persuade anyone to pay it. Everyone is surviving on coppers as it is.
Yes, well, whatever. Needs must. Think up a new tax.
A new tax!
I'm not sure that's such-
Be quiet serf.
Hey you-

Yes, I was having a discussion with King Vargas the other day. He was saying some places have taxes for all kinds of things; fur taxes, blueberry taxes, tea taxes, playing card taxes. All we need to do is pick something
that lots of people have. How about a Window Tax? We have windows on the island.
A Window Tax?
Yes, yes. That's an excellent idea. I now institute a new Window Tax. Every building with windows. Other countries have Window Taxes, we need them as well.
Err, what? I'm not sure I agree with-
How am I going to sell this one?
Well, you had better find a way, and fast! Oh, you seem like someone who gets things done. I now appoint you official tax collector of Jatizso!
Why would I want to be a tax collector for a-
Did you say something?
Shhh! Please whisper, ! For both our sakes just agree, otherwise he'll get into one of his moods, and who knows what he'll pronounce.
! I command you to refill the royal coffers! Thorkel will work out the details.
You don't have space for the King's tax bag.
How is this island supposed to develop if we keep spending all our money on his paranoid schemes?
Thorkel, can you tell me about this taxation?
You need to speak with some of the citizens of Jatizso and collect their taxes.
Count the number of windows on each building and tax the people who work inside. 1000 per window.
The only people who earn any real money on the island are shopkeepers. Soldiers clearly do not need to be taxed, as paying soldiers' wages is part of the reason for the tax in the first place.
Once you have finished collecting the taxes, come and speak to me again.
Thank you for helping our fine city.
Have you collected the Window Taxes yet?
Not yet, though I've just noticed that this building has more windows in it than any other building.
And your point is?
Oh, nothing. I'll get back to collecting taxes.
Good.
Hurry, I need to see my treasury overflowing!
Go and speak with Thorkel if you need to know who to tax.
Can you tell me who I should tax?
Well, for the Window Tax, only those who use a building.
Go to each of the buildings in town:
The armourer's hut and the weaponsmith's hut, the eating hall, and the fish shop; all these buildings need to be taxed. The royal hall doesn't need to be taxed, nor the bank or any empty buildings.
Count the number of windows the building has and then ask one of the people who works there to pay the tax.
The tax is currently 1000gp per window.
As you do so your tax bag will fill up slowly. When you've taxed everyone you can, come back here and talk to me or the King.
Oh, hello. Tax collector, huh? You're not going to tax me are you?
Not right now. You haven't lived here for a while anyway, and the King seems most keen to tax shopkeepers, so I reckon you are tax exempt!
Phew! In that case, can I do anything for you?
Not yet. I have a small task I must complete in order to ingratiate myself with King Sorvott.
Really?
I jest not.
Well then, you'd better get on with it.
Don't give me the tax bag until you have collected tax from everyone!
Ah, sorry. I'll be right back
Something odd has happenend to your tax bag. Let's try and sort it out.
Where's your tax bag?
I've left it in the bank.
Hey! Carry that tax bag around with you while collecting tax, otherwise where will you put the money?
Ah, yes.
Hello, I'm the tax collector. Got any windows I can tax?
I dream of windows.
I need to talk to you about tax.
Hmm, a fascinating subject, I'm sure.
I think you owe the state some tax.
Is that so?
So hand it over!
I will do, I will do. Oh, I have a question. Do you use a bank?
Of course!
Often?
Yes, every day.
Wouldn't it be awkward if banks started charging for their services?
Err...
And what would happen if those charges were backdated to all previous bank visits?
How much would that be I wonder? Say, if we charged 10gp per transaction. Let me work it out and you can take it away from the tax. 10, 20, 30...
Okay, I get the picture. I'm happy to announce you are exempt from taxation this year.
Really? That's fortunate - I won't need to implement bank charges then.
Ho hum, I suppose bankers know how to save money...
I have been appointed by the King to collect taxes.
That's nice for you.
I'm afraid the King has instituted a new tax on windows. It is 1000gp per window. Fortunately you only need to pay once per building.
Oh, another one of the King's paranoid schemes. He's like a parasite sucking the life out of the town. Alright, how much does he want?
What? Can't you count? I'm not paying my tax to someone who can't count.
That's not right. I'm not paying you that much!
*sigh* It seems a lot of money for some windows.
This tax does seem a little harsh on you.
But rules are rules. Pay up!
I'll think about it a bit.
I'll be back later.
More taxes? How depressing.
I'm afraid the King has instituted a new Window Tax to pay for the defence of the realm. It is 1000gp per window. The tax is per building so only one of you have to pay.
Why should I pay Window Tax when I don't want any windows. I'd be more than happy staring at the blank walls. How much money are we supposed to pay?
What? Can't you count? I'm not paying my tax to someone who can't count.
That's not right. I'm not paying you that much!
*sigh* It seems a lot of money for some windows.
It's tax time I'm afraid.
But we only paid our Island Tax last week!
I'm afraid the King has instituted a new Window Tax. 1000gp per window.
What?
*sigh* How much do you want?
What? Can't you count? I'm not paying my tax to someone who can't count.
That's not right. I'm not paying you that much!
*sigh* It seems a lot of money for some windows.
I suppose I could pay the tax for you.
Thank you, thank you! I owe you one.
But we only paid our Island Tax last week!
What?
*sigh* How much do you want?
What? Can't you count? I'm not paying my tax to someone who can't count.
That's not right. I'm not paying you that much!
*sigh* It seems a lot of money for some windows.
I thought that was all done for the month.
I'm afraid the King has instituted a new Window Tax to pay for the defence of the realm. It is 1000gp per window. The tax is paid on a building-by-building basis. Only one of you needs to pay...
You expect me to pay a tax for THESE windows. They're not windows, they are holes in the wall! Bah! How much do you want?
What? Can't you count? I'm not paying my tax to someone who can't count.
That's not right. I'm not paying you that much!
*sigh* It seems a lot of money for some windows.
You do not need to collect taxes from me this time. Begone with you!
I've collected the Window Taxes as instructed.
Excellent. Chancellor, we must have enough money to pay for the new equipment.
Err, not quite.
Bah! Again, brave Jatizso citizens, sacrifices must be made.
Yes sire.
Hmmm. Any ideas anyone?
How about beer?
Beer? No that's a silly thing to tax. No, that really would cause a riot. Hmmm, beer, beers, beards. Beards!
Beards. Only the King and his advisors should be allowed un-taxed beards.
I now proclaim there will be a new tax on beards.
So NOW you want me to collect money from everyone that has a beard. I'm not sure whether to laugh or cry.
What about moustaches?
Oh yes, tax those too.
Grrr. Of course you do, sire.
Hurry, I need to see my treasury overflowing! You have a Beard Tax to collect.

Well for the Beard Tax, talk to anyone who works in the town; shopkeepers and the like. Don't ask anyone else, as they won't have the money to be taxed! Also don't bother with the bank manager - he has plenty of
money, but seems most adept at keeping it.
So, talk to each of the following and assess whether they are taxable or not.

Raum Urda-Stein trades armour and Hring Hring trades ores. Skuli Myrka trades in weapons, Vanligga Gastfrihet looks after the food hall, Flosi Dalksson sells raw fish and Keepa Kettilon supposedly cooks - though
I haven't seen him actually cook anything for months.
Once you've talked to everyone, come back here and we will check the tax bag again. Hopefully it will be enough to satisfy the King this time.
Hello, I'm the tax collector. I'm taxing beards and I can't help noticing you have a beard.
What? I'm a beggar. Do I look as if I have any money? Look, take everything I own why don't you?
Err, thanks. Maybe I don't need to tax you.
No, take it!
I don't care any more.
You ask me for tax but your bag is so full of stuff you can't even hold the pittance that is the whole of my belongings! Go away and leave me to beg in peace.
I return once more...
I would say I'm happy to see you, but that would be a lie.
Well, I can't say I blame you, since I need to tax you again.
Gah! What weak excuse for sucking his populace dry has the King come up with this time?
This time the King has decided to tax facial hair!
According to my books, you owe 1000gp!
By all that is holy, this is a travesty!
You may have a point there.
But rules are rules. Pay up! You owe the state 1000.
I'm back for more tax.
I should have guessed.
Please no. I have a wife and seven kids to support.
No more! Haven't we all suffered enough?
I sympathise; it's been a very taxing day for me as well.
Groan! Your lame attempts at humour do not save me money. Come on, break it to me gently, what is it this time?
But I don't have a beard!
Yes you do!
No, this hair is just an extension of my head hair, which is currently not being taxed.
Yeah right, no more excuses!
Awww come on, be a gent.
No more! This is an outrage!
It is a bit, isn't it. Still, he's your King not mine!
Oh, thanks a lot 'friend'. What is it this time?
Don't ask me why, but this time it's beards!
WHAT? This is the last straw. My father wore a beard, my father's father wore a beard; many generations of Fremennik have worn beards with pride, without having to worry whether his pride and joy
would cost him money. A beard is the core of a Fremennik's identity, it is the gateway to his soul, it is...
Alright, I get the idea.
I cannot take any more of this! What ridiculous thing is worthy of taxation this time?
Errm, it's beards this time!
But I don't have a beard, I have a finely waxed moustache. I'm definitely not beardy at all.
I'm afraid all facial hair counts for tax purposes.
Surely, facial hair should be taxed on percentage of the face covered. In which case I should owe no more than 20% of the tax that wild-bearded Fremennik men pay.
Sorry, facial hair is facial hair and is liable for taxation. No arguments.
That's not fair!
My faith in humanity has been sapped again. Thanks for that. Here take the money and get out of my sight.
I have taken money from those with significant facial hair.
Good, good. Chancellor, how do our finances look now?
Errr.
Thank the gods, we finally have enough.
Ah, much better. I always find the sound of gold coins being poured into the treasury relaxing.
Yes, I don't think your citizens would have coped with another round of tax.

I have another task for you. Your espionage mission was so successful that I need you to do the same thing again. Except this time I want you to find out more about the bridge repairs they have been doing.
Bridge repairing?
Indeed! I have heard rumours that they have been getting some help from somewhere.
Really? I wonder who?
You'd better find out and quickly. Get on it!
Go to Neitiznot with all haste! The Spymaster will have the details, as last time.
I'm afraid i'm not allowed to talk to you any more. It would be more than my life is worth!
Fair enough. I'd better go...
Hello tax collector.
I had a job to do. That's the way it goes sometimes.
But I do feel a little guilty about the tax actually.
Or at least I would do if I had the 5000 gp on me...
Thanks! I didn't expect that. Maybe you do have a heart.
Can you keep a secret?
Well I'm off then.
Fine.
Whatever.
Hello, Vanligga!
Oh, hello. Always good to see a friend.
Hmmm, I suppose I can trust you, since you have done me a favour in the past. Can you keep a secret?
Of course.
Well as you probably already know all yak meat and yak products are banned on this island - orders of the King...
That King has some very strange attitudes.
Well, I have a contact on the other island. Are you interested in obtaining some produce?
Well, any time you need black market yak produce, you know where to come.
You should speak with the ruler of this isle, King Gjuki Sorvott IV.
You should speak with the ruler of this isle, King Gjuki Sorvott IV.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
I am sure you know what I require of you by now.
You must entertain the ruler of Neitiznot while listening to the conversations of his council.
That should not be a problem.
You must wear all four pieces of the jester costume and nothing in your hands, as the Burgher's guards will search you thoroughly.
Don't forget to put your costume on, then visit the Burgher and get jestering.
Well, I've got the ridiculous costume on again.
Excellent. Time to visit the Burgher and get jestering.
Ah, hello jester. Hey! I've just noticed, you look a little similar to our new champion!
You have a jester and a fool as a Champion?
No, of course not, that would be silly. You just...look similar.
We must both be outlanders. We all look the same you know.
Yes, you're right of course. Anyway, I think the Burgher is in the mood for some more entertainment, so carry on through.
Hello jester. Have a chat with the Burgher, I think he's in the mood for jest.
I think the Burgher could do with a laugh right now. Why don't you ask him?
Have you finished your spying task yet?
Not yet. I'll finish it off now.
Ah, good timing. I was just thinking I needed a bit of light entertainment.
Ah, back again. I hope you've got a new act.
Err, of course sire. I assure you this act will be somewhat different.
Get on with it then.
When you said you had a new act you were lying weren't you?
I can recite the epic tale of Beowulf if you prefer. It'll only take four or five hours.
No, no, no, your old act is fine. I've had more than enough Beowulf. My tutor made me study that tale again and again.
**Yawwwn**.
Get on with it! The more slapstick, the better.
I'm happy to humiliate myself for your entertainment, sire.
Are you ready to make your report, ?
Yes, I am.
Now I will ask you some questions, but be warned I have other sources of information that can corroborate your answers.
I am ready to answer your questions.
Where are Neitiznot's militia?
They are in a secluded bay, near Etceteria.
What will Thakkrad deliver to Neitiznot's militia tonight?
They will be given some potions.
Who has been helping Burgher Mawnis Burowgar?
I have been helping Neitiznot.
Hmmm, that is very interesting. I believe you're telling me the truth.
Clearly not. Well, here is your fee.
You don't have space for the King's reward.
Right, you had better go and talk to the King. I expect he'll want to discuss your intelligence.
No, I need to make a fool of myself again.
Please pay more attention to what the Burgher's advisors say this time. Are you ready?
Indeed, you look very dapper in your costume.
Hmmm. I'm beginning to think that this spy malarkey is not as cool as I thought.
You're ready to entertain the Burgher. Good luck with you mission, Operative Budgie. Stay alert.
When you are done, come back and talk to me to give your report. I will make sure the King is informed.
Shhh. Go away. I'm not allowed to talk to you.
Fine, whatever...
I have just one final task before you leave.
Guards, secure the doors!
So you admit that it was you who repaired Neitiznot's bridges?
I was following your orders, Sir.
I was given strict instructions to go along with Mawnis Burowgar's orders while investigating their island.
As I told your fool of a Spymaster, Neitiznot's militia are not going to attack you.
Then why does Burgher Mawnis Burowgar amass an army?
It is no army Neitiznot has trained, but a raiding party, sire.
Mawnis Burowgar's goal is to see the leader of the trolls beheaded.
Do you take me for a fool ? It's all lies!
You must have been brainwashed by my cousin! He is EVIL and wants to destroy me! Jah! Tiz so! Jah! Tiz so!
Right! That's it! I've had enough!
No more lying! No more biting my tongue! Do I take you for a fool? Yes I do!
You are so paranoid about Neitiznot that you are running this island into the ground!

Neitiznot is not going to attack Jatizso. I'll say it again to try and force it into your thick skull! Neitiznot is not going to attack Jatizso. They don't care about Jatizso. They care about the trolls and Troll King who
are the real threats to the islands. You are so obsessed with your cousin, however, that you stick your head
in the sand whenever it comes to the trolls. But I'm not sure it matters, since I think there is a good chance that you will destroy this village long before the trolls get here!
You do not have to dress in a jester's costume to act the fool, your royal crown is more than enough!
No-one has ever talked to me like that before.
Maybe if they had, you wouldn't be in this mess.
I should have you beheaded.
I'd like to see you try.
So it seems that my cousin's plan is to demonstrate his superiority by killing the Troll King. I cannot let that happen! I will not let him steal the glory.
You haven't listened to a single word I've been saying, have you?
We amass our forces now! There is no time to lose.
At dawn my men will march upon my ancestor's nemesis, the Troll King.

Do you even know where to find the Troll King? Your warriors are underfed and tired; your weapons inadequate. You don't stand a chance. Join with your brethren and you may share the glory and perhaps find
a way to make peace between your lands. I'm sure the Burgher would be glad of your aid.

Bah! Don't be ridiculous! He would just stab me in the back and claim the glory himself. My brave warriors will find the Troll King and slay him first. How could they not, they are Jatizso warriors, not Neitiznot scum.
You will deliver my decree to Burgher Mawnis Burowgar.
You shall inform him that my troops attack the western troll caves at dawn and that his interference shall be considered an act of WAR! Long live Jatizso! Long live ME!
Fine. I give up. I will do this final task for you. After that you're on your own - may the gods be with your troops - they're going to need it.
Fine. Take the decree and go.
Have you delivered the decree yet?
Well, get a move-on.
Not yet, I've lost the decree.
You've lost it! Bah! It's a good thing I'm used to working with incompetents!
I'm afraid I don't have the space to carry it.
More incompetence! Well, come back when you have.
Well? Get moving!
Ah, the Burgher is keen to see you. Walk on through.
You should speak to Fridleif or the Burgher about crafting yourself the traditional armour of a Fremennik warrior.
My militia are en route from Rellekka. Have you found out anything about Jatizso's plans yet?
I was instructed to give you this, err, now where did I put the King's decree?
I'll be back shortly.
I have, sir.
I was instructed to give you this decree by King Sorvott.
King Sorvott has spies that have learnt of the troops you have trained.
Until recently, they believed that you planned to assault their town.
The paranoid fool.
It would bring great shame upon my family to break the truce that was signed between King Sorvott III and my father.
Now that Jatizso's spies have learnt of your plans to attack the troll caves, King Sorvott is raising his guards to assault them himself.
I believe he plans to depart before you can be ready.
Well, if he thinks the folk of Neitiznot can be intimidated by his threats, he best be ready to accept defeat.
Blasted spies, how can King Sorvott call himself a Fremennik when he resorts to such dishonourable tactics?
We have no time to lose. Fridleif, please guide through the traditions laid down by our ancestors.
Once you have completed these rites I shall appoint you as head of my raiding party.
Indeed, it is written in the sagas of Neitiznot that the Champion of the isle must equip himself with the tools of a Fremennik warrior.
I offer to act as guide to during the traditional rites.
Very well. What do these rites entail?
Firstly, you must equip yourself with the traditional armour of Neitiznot.
You will need to cull several yaks in order to craft yourself a suit of yak-hide armour.
Once you have a few pieces of yak-hide, return to me and I shall cure them for you.
Then I will give you instruction on how this hide may be crafted into a thick jerkin, ideal for protecting yourself from the granite clubs that the trolls of these isles prefer to wield.
Thank you, Fridleif. I shall return with the yak-hides soon.
I have still to complete the traditional armour of a Fremennik warrior.
Thakkrad? Explain to what she needs to do again.
Of course, sire.

You will need to cull several yaks in order to craft yourself a suit of yak-hide armour. There is a fenced-in field to the west of the village where yaks roam freely. Once you have a few pieces of yak-hide, return to me
To make the traditional armour of a Neitiznot warrior you will need some yak-hide to make the armour.
Once you have the yak-hide, Thakkrad can cure it for you.
To make the shield you will need some arctic pine, rope and bronze nails. Then you will need to find the 'Woodcutting stumps' to make make the shield on.
Thanks for the advice, Fridlief. Where are these 'Woodcutting stumps'?
You will find the Woodcutting stumps near the town's 'geyser'.
Oh, it's you. Why are you talking to me? Surely you should be hanging out with your Neitiznot friends now.
Alright I will - if that's the way you're going to be about it.
Goodbye.
Goodbye.
You are carrying yak-hide, are you not?
How did you know that?
The aroma, outlander! It's very distinctive. So, do you wish to get your hide cured?
Cure my yak-hide, please.
I will cure yak-hide for a fee of 5 gp per hide.
You don't have enough gold to pay me!
There you go.
Bye.
Can you cure any other type of leather?
Other types of leather? Why would you need any other type of leather?
I'll take that as a no then.
No, thanks. I'll be off then.
I see you have made some of the armour. Do you need assistance with the other part?
Yes please, I've forgotten how to make the armour.
Thakkrad, can you explain?
and I shall cure them for you. Once cured, a normal needle and thread will be needed to craft the yak leather in the same way as any other leather.
Have you completed your suit of yak armour?
Thakkrad has helped me to complete the traditional armour of a Fremennik warrior.
Excellent news. Now you have just one more item to craft and I can appoint you as leader of my warband; then you may lead our raid against the trolls.
The final piece of traditional arms is a large Fremennik round shield.
With this you will be able to deflect the large rocks that some of the trolls like to throw at you.
How may this be crafted?
You will need two arctic pine logs, a length of rope, some bronze nails and a hammer.
When you have all of these you should find the tree stump outside of my hut. You will be able to hammer together the shield.
Thank you. I shall return with a shield soon.
Have you completed the final piece of your Fremennik garb?
I have still to complete the traditional shield of a Fremennik warrior.
Fridleif has helped me to complete the traditional shield of the Fremennik warrior.
Excellent work,.
There is little more for me to say. You have proven your worth to my kinsmen and I, but I must continue with the traditions so...
Do you, solemnly swear to uphold the virtues of courage and honour?
Thakkrad whispers in your ear. Just repeat what I say.
'I, swear to uphold the virtues of courage and honour.'
I swear to uphold the virtues of courage and honour.
Then it is done.
I hearby appoint as Champion of Neitiznot.
Praise be; may the blood of our ancestors flow strongly in our new Champion.
Welcome to the clan of Neitiznot; you shall be welcome in this township forever more.
You have made our township very proud today. We hope you continue to match up to our hopes in the quest which we have for you.
As my kinsmen have mentioned, there is a foul beast dwelling in the caves on the northernmost isle.
We ask that you lead our militia against this brute and return with the beast's head as proof of your heroism.
My guards have secured a foothold within the easternmost caves.
We have not seen Jatizso's militia yet, but some of my scouts have reported hearing distant fighting in the tunnels.
I shall make my way over to them now, so that we may defeat this foul Troll King.
You should head to the eastern end of the northern isle. You don't want to run in to Jatizso's troops now.
Fridleif's scouts have reported that the militia have entered the caves to the east of the northern isle. They are waiting for you to lead them in battle.
Our militia have entered the caves to the east of the northern isle.
You should hurry to meet them before they are discovered by the trolls. Make sure you go to the right cave entrance, otherwise you won't find them!
Right, the eastern caves on the northern isle. Thanks Fridleif, I'm on my way there now.
Hmm. Left, right, then left again... I'm lost. Best I head toward the sound of the fighting.
Hold your ground men!
The Champion had better arrive soon. We can't wait much longer!
will be here soon. The Burgher trusts. That's good enough for me.
Sir, Champion has arrived! I knew wouldn't let us down!
It was a hard journey here. I trust you all made it here intact?
A little bruised but nothing a true Fremennik can't handle!
Well said!
Our supplies are starting to run a little low; we should make our charge soon.
Once you have helped to slay 10 trolls then you should be able to assault the Troll King.
We will hold back the troll forces while you cross the bridge to the south of the cave.
I will find the Troll King there, correct?
Yes madam! I have some supplies with me if you need them, but I only have a small amount left. We took a heavy toll getting here.
The fact you've saved any at all proves your bravery.
Thank you madam. We have food, Strength potions and Prayer potions to see us through this battle.
A fine tale we will tell once you have claimed the beast's head.
Men, follow 's orders.
Ready, men?
Warriors, advance!
Bork! The battle rages on and we are strong, but I need supplies!
What do you need, brave, madam?
Give me food, Bork!
Here, take this tuna quickly, madam!
I need Strength potions.
Strength be with you, !
I need Prayer potions.
May the gods be with you !
I don't need anything.
I've run out of supplies, ! Only our bravery remains.
My guards will beat you to your goal yet.
The weakness of wood and leather will be bested by my steel and mithril; mark my words.
I sense defeat in your voice already, mighty King.
You and I both know that Burgher Burowgar's forces are better prepared and trained than your men.
Guards, prepare my gallows at once.
I would be leaving now if I were you,.
I think you're right Thorkel, goodbye.
What are you doing in my court? Guards!
I have come to inform you that you may recall your guards; the Troll King was slain by my hand.
Preposterous. Lies, I tell you, lies!
Yes, your majesty, of course your majesty.
Guards.
Guards! Where are your Guards?
Oh. Are they still recovering from their defeat against the trolls?
Outlander, leave me in peace before I am forced to bear arms against you myself.
Very well, your Highness, I leave you to contemplate this...
Should you have approached me honestly and truthfully, rather than with lies and secrecy,
then it could have been you holding the head of the Troll King aloft today.
Be gone with you. I have heard enough of your insults for one day.
Thanks, you are the first person to stand up to the King's bullying in many a year. Maybe he has learnt something today?
We can but hope Thorkel.
Fare thee well brave warrior, fare thee well.
Purrrrz!
Useless, disloyal cat.
Hail the conquering hero!
Heh. Thanks - I was pretty heroic even if I say so myself.
Congratulations on defeating the Troll King. I hope you have collected the fine rewards that the Burgher Mawnis Burowgar has for you.
I have returned victorious, Mawnis Burowgar.
Do you bring proof of your victory?
Nope.
You should bring proof to present to the Burgher.
Hail, Champion of Neitiznot.
I offer the beast's head as proof that I have completed your task, sir.
I thank you for bringing me this trophy, you have done much to bring honour to this isle.
My thanks for the honour you have bestowed upon me, Mawnis Burowgar.
As a mark of my gratitude for slaying my nemesis, the foul Troll King, I offer you my helm.
I thank you for presenting me with such a finely crafted helm, sir.
It makes me proud to know that the helm of my ancestors will be worn in battle.
I thank you on behalf of all my Kinsmen,.
Praise be to our brave Champion.
Hail, Champion.
Thakkrad, I believe you have finished repairing the remaining bridge.
That I have sir, we should be able to mine 'runite' once again; now that I have repaired the north-eastern bridge.
Ah, so that is how we compete with the mineral wealth of Jatizso.
Indeed, the wealth of these isles may not be spread evenly, but we certainly make the most of what we have.
I look forward to any other tasks you may have for me in the future, Burgher Burowar.
My next task is to make peace with the King of Jatizso.
I do not think I can help you with that sire. I don't think King Sorvott is speaking with me anymore.
Ah, I see you too have angered King Sorvott IV.
Not to worry, I have my ways of pacifying the King.
Fare thee well, my Champion.
Fare thee well.
Fair thee well, kinsmen of Neitiznot.
I am proud that the helm of my ancestors will be worn in battle. I thank you on behalf of all my kinsmen, Dokdur.
I thank you again for presenting me with such a helm.
Have you got any more of those helms?
What, the priceless heirloom that I gave to you as a sign of my trust and gratitude?
Err yes, that one. I may have mislaid it.
It's a good job I have alert and loyal men who notice when such a precious item is left laying around, and who pick it up.
I'm afraid I'm going to have to charge you a 50,000 coin handling cost.
Well, yes, I do. But I'm going to have to charge you 50,000 coins - these are precious, you know!
I don't have that much money on me.
Well, come back when you do.
Very well, I accept.
I don't think I can afford that, sorry.
Well, come back when you can.
Ho, ! The brave warrior returns!
It was a hard-fought battle, but we Fremennik prevailed!
I expect we'll be hearing songs about the 'Slayer of the Troll King' for many years to come.
It would be an honour to be remembered in such a way! Thanks.
Thank you for leading the Burgher's militia against the Troll King.
Now that the trolls are leaderless I have repaired the bridge to the central isle for you as best I can.
Thanks Thakkrad. Does that mean I have access to the runite ores on that island?
Yes, you should be able to mine runite there if you wish.
Congratulations, Champion Dokdur. Thank you for defeating the Troll King.
